pr_title: Minor pom cleanup and switched assertions to junit5

timeline.message: minor pom cleanup and switched assertions to junit5 because class was already switched to junit5

replies.bodyText: It is part of the parent pom- So I thought removing it would not have an effect. Especially since it is older than the parent pom version.
replies.author: StefanSpieker

replies.bodyText:
This actually removes spotbugs from the published bom as we are using bom mode for the maven flatten plugin
(I double checked by running mvn install and looked at the resultant file in my local repo)
replies.author: jtnord

replies.bodyText: Ok, thanks for double checking. Can I remove the version, so that we at least have the same as the parent pom?
replies.author: StefanSpieker

replies.bodyText: And I should then introduce the optional tag, because we do not need it in runtime. Would then also be the recommended dependency, as stated here: https://spotbugs.readthedocs.io/en/stable/migration.html#com-google-code-findbugs-findbugs-annotations
replies.author: StefanSpieker

replies.bodyText:
Can I remove the version

that I am not sure about you would have to test it, but I have a feeling the answer is no.

And I should then introduce the optional tag

no, should be handled where it is used -> https://github.com/jenkinsci/plugin-pom/blob/e2c98043e8f86fd8c71e134030a3e3829ee20d75/pom.xml#L205-L210
replies.author: jtnord

replies.bodyText:
You were right. I have to specify the version.
So maybe introducing the property to the parent pom would be the right approach? I will create a PR for that.
replies.author: StefanSpieker
